meanings.definition: To value or estimate too highly
meanings.sent1: She keeps overvaluing her old toys, thinking they are worth a lot.
meanings.sent2: He tends to overvalue his own abilities, which can lead to disappointment.
meanings.sent3: The cat was overvaluing the empty box as if it were a treasure chest.
meanings.sent4: By overvaluing her collection, she missed out on selling it at a good price.
meanings.sent5: Overvaluing his friendship with the celebrity, he was heartbroken when he got no response.

meanings.definition: To place too high a value on
meanings.sent1: Overvaluing expensive brands can lead to unnecessary spending.
meanings.sent2: She is overvaluing the importance of winning this game.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was overvaluing the acorn, thinking it was made of gold.
meanings.sent4: By overvaluing material possessions, we often overlook the true value of relationships.
meanings.sent5: Overvaluing his own opinion, he failed to consider other perspectives.

meanings.definition: To assign too high a value to
meanings.sent1: The art collector was overvaluing the painting, believing it to be a masterpiece.
meanings.sent2: Overvaluing academic success can put unnecessary pressure on students.
meanings.sent3: The robot was overvaluing the importance of a single screw in its system.
meanings.sent4: By overvaluing external beauty, we may miss the true essence of a person.
meanings.sent5: Overvaluing his own contribution, he failed to recognize the team effort.
